title: Guide to downtown
name: Guide to downtown
description:
A Map by Markgould

A brief guide to Burlington attractions for first-year St. Michael's students

properties.name: Church Street Marketplace
properties.description: Posted by Markgould2 Church St Ste 2j, Burlington, VTBy far the most heavily trafficked and well-known tourist destination in town is the Church Street Marketplace. The brick-lined street is framed by both local and popular chain stores that span four blocks. Restaurants and bars offer outdoor seating to those willing to wait for luxury.

properties.name: City Market
properties.description: Posted by Markgould82 S Winooski AveStep inside City Market and you will find a grocery store driven by the "eat local" movement. Fresh produce from local farmers provides a tasty snack as well as the chance to support Vermont\'s agricultural economy.

properties.name: Dobrá Tea
properties.description: Posted by Markgould 80 Church St. Burlington, VTChoose from more than 70 varieties of tea in this quiet downtown tea room. A knowledgeable server will help you browse through a thick menu, boasting exotic blends such as zheng shan xiao zhong Chinese tea and the sweet smell of Jerusalem Indian tea. Take a break from your studies to relax, or bring homework and make use of the available wireless Internet.

properties.name: Flynn Center for the Performing Arts
properties.description: Posted by Markgould 153 Main St Burlington VTPick up a Flynn Center/SMC Cultural Pass to gain access to dozens of worldly shows, concerts and performances throughout the school year. Or,purchase tickets to individual events like the Sept. 19 Ben Harper & the Innocent Criminals show.

properties.name: Henry's Diner
properties.description: Posted by Markgould 155 Bank St, BurlingtonLooking for a taste bud-pleasing, artery-squeezing platter of eggs, cheese, potatoes, and corned beef? Worried that it\'s 4 a.m. on a Saturday and not even the lighted golden arches still shine? Henry\'s Diner has you covered. And unlike some establishments that claim diner status, Herny\'s won\'t stop serving breakfast at noon.

properties.name: Lake Champlain waterfront
properties.description: Posted by Markgould1 College St Burlington, VTGrab your girlfriend and camera and stroll along this picturesque tourist destination. With unobstructed views of the lake and the Adirondack Mountains as a backdrop, this is a must-see for students.

properties.name: Local Motion
properties.description: Posted by Markgould1 Steele Street, Burlington, VTThe nonprofit organization has championed safer paths for bikers and walkers since 1999. Rent a bike or try on some roller blades and coast through miles of paved waterfront paths. A wall of pamphlets advertises a variety of walking, hiking, and cycling destinations and activities.

properties.name: Outdoor Gear Exchange
properties.description: Posted by Markgould152 Cherry St, Burlington, VT 05401Vermont offers the rare opportunity to participate in a plethora of outdoor activities all within a short drive from campus. The area\'s unique geographical features beckon young, suburban minds to explore the natural world. The Outdoor Gear Exchange manages to pack equipment from dozens of sports into one location. And for those on a tight budget, take advantage of the consigned equipment section.

properties.name: Vermont Pub and Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Markgould144 College St, Burlington, VT 05401You\'re not 21 yet, and thus cannot enjoy more than 20 varieties of beer that Vermont Pub and Brewery offers, but you can take advantage of a very reasonably priced lunch and dinner menu. Wet your taste buds with hot sandwiches for now. Come back in three years and you can wash it down with an award-winning Red Burly Irish Ale.
